You will proceed to the annotation interface we’re using for this task, preloaded with your assigned abstracts for annotation. 

  • For each abstract, check the box next to “Values” under the heading “Highlight texts explicitly encoding research values.” 
  • Highlight text spans in the abstracts that correspond to research values based on the definition and examples provided in this document. 
    • If you’d like to delete a highlight you created, click on the highlighted span. 
  • If you are unsure about whether a text span should be considered a research value, you should follow the rules in the guideline book and use your best judgment! [CLICK HERE]
  • After highlighting, please summarize the lifted research values that the abstract contains in the free text box on the right side. Instead of copying and pasting the text spans, please summarize the lifted values with higher-level words, such as “performance”, “accuracy”, “novelty”, “fairness”, etc. based on a high level descriptor you think the value can be associated with.
  • Click “Move forward” or “Move backward” to move between your assigned abstracts.
